pair.Response:
Prompt: In the case of Minneapolis & St. Louis R. Co. v. U.S., what was the standard of public interest used by the Commission?
Response: The Commission used the standard of "separate and independent management" of Western as the criterion governing the comparative merits of the rival plans in the case of Minneapolis & St. Louis R. Co. v. U.S., and ultimately found that the public interest would be best served by Western's continued operation as a "separate and independent carrier." The case was decided on October Term, 1959, with the opinion of the Court being 361 U. S.
